ApiSpec.description:
Abstract base class for API specifications.

Defines the interface for API specifications that can fetch data
and return standardized data structures. Subclasses implement
specific API standards (JSONPath, GraphQL, etc.).

spec_variant.description: Semantic purpose of the API response: 'underlying-history' for time series data (multiple date-value pairs), 'product-fsv' for final settlement value (single date-value pair)

standard.description: API standard/protocol used (must be overridden by subclasses with specific Literal type)

ApiSpec.title: ApiSpec

ApiSpecJSONPath.description:
JSONPath specification for extracting timeseries data from API responses.

This class provides a flexible way to specify how to extract standardized
timeseries data from various JSON APIs using JSONPath expressions.
Supports both historical timeseries and latest value extraction.

auth_param_location.description: Where to place the authentication parameter, or 'none' for public APIs

auth_param_prefix.description: Prefix for auth value in headers (e.g., 'Bearer ', 'API-Key '). Only applicable when auth_param_location is 'header'
auth_param_prefix.title: Auth Param Prefix

continuation_token_param.description: Query parameter name to send continuation token in next request (e.g., 'start_timestamp', 'cursor', 'next')
continuation_token_param.title: Continuation Token Param

continuation_token_path.description: JSONPath expression to extract continuation token from response for pagination (e.g., '$.result.continuation', '$.next_token')
continuation_token_path.title: Continuation Token Path

date_format_custom.description: Custom strftime format string (required when date_format_type='custom')
date_format_custom.title: Date Format Custom

date_format_type.description: Date format type: 'iso_8601' (ISO 8601: 2023-01-01T12:00:00Z, 2023-01-01, etc.), 'unix_timestamp' (1640995200), or 'custom' (requires date_format_custom)

date_path.description: JSONPath expression to extract date/timestamp(s): use array syntax like '$.data[*].timestamp' for multiple values, '$.timestamp' for single value
date_path.title: Date Path

headers.description: Optional HTTP headers to include in API requests
headers.title: Headers

max_pages.description: Maximum number of pages to fetch when pagination is enabled (prevents infinite loops)
max_pages.title: Max Pages

spec_variant.description: Semantic purpose of the API response: 'underlying-history' for time series data (multiple date-value pairs), 'product-fsv' for final settlement value (single date-value pair)

standard.description: API standard used (fixed for JSONPath implementations)
standard.title: Standard

timestamp_scale.description: Scale factor for unix timestamps: 1 for seconds, 1000 for milliseconds, 1000000 for microseconds
timestamp_scale.title: Timestamp Scale

timezone.description: IANA timezone identifier (e.g., UTC, America/New_York, Europe/London)
timezone.title: Timezone

url.description: API endpoint URL for data fetching
url.title: Url

value_path.description: JSONPath expression to extract numeric value(s): use array syntax like '$.data[*].price' for multiple values, '$.price' for single value
value_path.title: Value Path

ApiSpecJSONPath.title: ApiSpecJSONPath

condition.description: Describes what is being evaluated or measured. For scalar products: the question being asked (e.g., 'What will the {reference_date} US CPI-U value be?'). For binary products: the proposition being evaluated (e.g., '{outcome} wins the 2028 Republican Presidential Nomination'). Supports template variables from outcome_point.
condition.title: Condition

fsp_resolution.description: Detailed explanation of how the Final Settlement Price (FSP) is computed or determined in typical circumstances. For scalar products: describe the computation formula. For binary products: describe conditions for FSP=1 (max_price) vs FSP=0 (min_price). Should reference primary data sources.
fsp_resolution.title: Fsp Resolution

EdgeCase.description: Edge case with alternative FSP resolution logic.

condition.description: Describes when this edge case applies. Supports template variables from outcome_point.
condition.title: Condition

fsp_resolution.description: How FSP is determined when this condition is met. May specify that oracle does not submit FSP (product remains unsettled), or provide alternative computation logic.
fsp_resolution.title: Fsp Resolution

EdgeCase.title: EdgeCase

OutcomeSpace.description:
Base class for outcome spaces.

Defines a family of related prediction products that share common resolution logic.
An outcome space specifies how to evaluate outcomes and determine the Final Settlement
Price (FSP) for products within its family. Products in the same family reference the
same outcome_space CID and differ only in their outcome_point values.

base_case.description: Evaluation criteria for typical circumstances - how FSP is determined under normal conditions

description.description: Human-readable description of what this outcome space represents (e.g., 'US Consumer Price Index', 'Who will win the 2028 Republican Presidential Nomination?')
description.title: Description

edge_cases.description: Exceptional circumstances with alternative FSP resolution logic. Evaluated in order; first matching condition applies.
edge_cases.title: Edge Cases

fsp_type.description: Type of Final Settlement Price: 'scalar' for continuous values, 'binary' for 0/1 outcomes, 'ternary' for 0/0.5/1 outcomes
fsp_type.title: Fsp Type

OutcomeSpace.title: OutcomeSpace

OutcomeSpaceScalar.description:
Base class for scalar outcome spaces.

Defines outcome spaces that track continuous numeric values (as opposed to
discrete binary outcomes). Scalar products can represent economic indicators,
financial data, physical measurements, or any quantifiable metric.

fsp_type.description: Type of Final Settlement Price: must be 'scalar' for scalar outcome spaces
fsp_type.title: Fsp Type

source_name.description: Name of the original publisher or authoritative source of the data (e.g., 'Bureau of Labor Statistics', 'Federal Reserve', 'World Bank')
source_name.title: Source Name

source_uri.description: URL of the original publisher or authoritative source of the data
source_uri.title: Source Uri

units.description: Units represented by the scalar values (e.g., 'Percent (annualized)', 'USD', 'Index points', 'Basis points')
units.title: Units

OutcomeSpaceScalar.title: OutcomeSpaceScalar

SpecVariant.description: Semantic purpose of the API response.
SpecVariant.title: SpecVariant

description:
Time series outcome space for economic and financial data published periodically.

Defines a family of prediction products based on time series data (e.g., monthly CPI,
quarterly GDP, daily closing prices). All products in this family share the same data
source and evaluation logic but differ in their temporal coordinates (outcome_point).

frequency.description: Frequency of the underlying time series observations

history_api_spec.description: Optional API specification for fetching historical timeseries data
history_api_spec.title: History Api Spec

title: OutcomeSpaceTimeSeries
